   204.01  BENCH MARK; DATUM.
   All grade levels within the City shall be measured from the United States
Geodetic Survey marker nearest to the proposed work or construction.
(Ord. 639. Passed 3-6-61.)
 
   204.02   OFFICIAL CITY FLAG.
   (a).   The flag described in this section is hereby adopted as the official
flag of the City of Vermilion:
A three feet by nine feet pennant style flag having a royal blue background
with a white schooner imprinted thereon, such schooner being a copy of the
original schooner built at the City of Vermilion, Ohio.
 
   (b)   All City departments shall be furnished copies of this section by the
Clerk of Council so that they may display such flag when it is required or
deemed advisable in the operation ofthe various departments. 
(Ord. 71R-5.  Passed 4-19-71.)
 
   204.03  CITY SEAL.
   The seal of the City shall consist of the following design:
   A circular shield; showing a schooner resting beside a dock which supports a
small building; with trees and seagulls in the background; such scene to be
bounded with a rope and with the words "Vermilion, Ohio Harbour Town 1837" and
shall correspond substantially with the following design:
 
Mounted City Seal
(Res. 75R-35.  Passed 12-1-75.)

   206.01   DIVISION INTO WARDS.
   The territory of the City is divided into five wards.
   (a)   Ward One.
Situated in the City of Vermilion, Counties of Erie and Lorain and State of
Ohio.  Being known as part of Vermilion Township in Erie County and part of
Brownhelm Township in Lorain County and more definitely described as follows:
Beginning at the intersection of centerline of Edson Creek and the shoreline of
Lake Erie:
Thence easterly in the City’s northerly corporation line to a point in the
easterly line of Elberta Beach Subdivision, as recorded in Volume 10, pages 13
and 14 of Lorain County Plat Records;
Thence southerly in the easterly line of Elberta Beach Subdivision and the
southerly extension thereof, to a point in the centerline of the Norfolk &
Southern Railroad;
Thence northeasterly in the centerline of the Norfolk & Southern tracks
northeast to a point in the centerline of Liberty Avenue;
Thence easterly in the centerline of Liberty Avenue to a point in the
centerline of Highbridge Road;
Thence southerly in the centerline of Highbridge Road to a point in the
centerline of the Conrail tracks;
Thence northwesterly in the centerline of the Conrail tracks to a point in the
westerly line of Lorain County;
Thence northerly in the westerly line of Lorain County to a point in the
centerline of Liberty Avenue;
Thence westerly and southerly in the centerline of Liberty Avenue to a point in
the centerline of West River Road;
Thence southeasterly in the centerline of West River Road to a point in the
centerline of the Conrail tracks;
Thence westerly in the centerline of the Conrail tracks to a point at the
centerline of Edson Creek;
Thence northerly in the centerline of Edson Creek to the place of beginning.
   (b)   Ward Two.
Situated in the City of Vermilion, County of Erie and State of Ohio.  Being
known as part of Vermilion Township and more definitely described as follows:
Beginning at the intersection of the centerline of Edson Creek and the
shoreline of Lake Erie;
Thence westerly in the City’s northerly corporation line to the northwesterly
corner thereof;
Thence southerly in the City’s westerly corporation line to the southwesterly
corner thereof;
Thence generally easterly and northerly in the City’s southerly corporation
line to a point in the centerline of State Street;
Thence southerly in the centerline of State Street to a point in the centerline
of Sailorway Drive;
Thence easterly in the centerline of Sailorway Drive to a point in the
centerline of Douglas Street;
Thence northerly in the centerline of Douglas Street to a point in the
centerline of Haley Street;
Thence westerly in the centerline of Haley Street to a point in the centerline
of State Street;
Thence northerly in the centerline of State Street to a point in the centerline
of the Norfolk & Southern tracks;
Thence generally northeasterly in the centerline of the Norfolk & Southern
tracks to a point in the centerline of West River Road;
Thence generally southerly and easterly in the centerline of West River Road to
a point at the northwesterly line of West River Estates Subdivision No.  2, as
recorded in Volume 34, page 6 of the Lorain County Plat Records;
Thence northeasterly in the northwesterly line of West River Estates
Subdivision No.  2 to an angle point;
Thence easterly in the northerly line of said Subdivision, to a point in the
easterly line of Erie County;
Thence northerly in the easterly line of Erie County to a point in the
centerline of Liberty Avenue;
Thence generally westerly then southwesterly in the centerline of Liberty
Avenue to a point in the centerline of West River Road;
Thence southeasterly in the centerline of West River to a point in the
centerline of the Conrail tracks;
Thence westerly in the centerline of the Conrail tracks to a point in the
centerline of Edson Creek;
Thence northerly in the centerline of Edson Creek north to the place of
beginning.
   (c)   Ward Three.
Situated in the City of Vermilion, Counties of Erie and Lorain and State of
Ohio.  Being known as part of Vermilion Township in Erie County and part of
Brownhelm Township in Lorain County and more definitely described as follows:
Part 1:
Beginning at the intersection of the centerline of the Norfolk and Western
Railroad and the centerline of West River Road;
Thence generally southerly and southeasterly in the centerline of West River
Road, to a point in the westerly line of West River Estates Subdivision No.  2,
as recorded in Volume 34, Page 6 of Lorain County Plat Records;
Thence northeasterly in the northwesterly line of West River Estates
Subdivision No.  2, to an angle point therein;
Thence easterly in the northerly line of West River Estates Subdivision No.  2
to the northeasterly corner thereof;
Thence southerly in the easterly line of West River Estates Subdivision No.  2
to the southeasterly corner thereof;
Thence southwesterly in the southeasterly line of West River Estates
Subdivision No.  2, to an angle point in the easterly corporation of the City;
Thence southeasterly in the City’s easterly corporation line to an angle point
in the easterly line of Rolling Meadows Subdivision No.  1, as recorded in
Volume 33, Pages 35 and 36 of Lorain County Plat Records;
Thence generally southerly in the easterly line of Rolling Meadows Subdivision
No.  1 and the easterly corporation line of the City to a southeasterly corner
thereof;
Thence westerly in the City’s southerly corporation line to a point in the
westerly line of Lorain County;
Thence northerly in the westerly line of Lorain County, to the southeast corner
of land owned by Jasbir and Tonia Kalouria as annexed to the City.
Thence southwesterly along the northerly line of the SR-2 L/A to the southwest
corner of the Kalouria parcel;
Thence northerly along the west line of the Kalouria parcel and the corporation
line;
Thence in general westerly and northerly direction in the City’s corporation
lines, to a point in the centerline of Sailorway;
Thence easterly in the centerline of Sailorway, to a point in the centerline of
Douglas Street;
Thence northerly in the centerline of Douglas Street, to a point in the
centerline of Haley Street;
Thence westerly in the centerline of Haley Street, to a point in the centerline
of State Street;
Thence northerly in the centerline of State Street to a point in the centerline
of the Norfolk & Western Railroad;
Thence northeasterly in the centerline of the Norfolk & Western Railroad, to
the place of beginning.
Part 2:
Beginning in the westerly line of West River Road and the southerly line of
Mapleview Drive;
Thence southerly and easterly along the corporation line to the centerline of
the Vermilion River;
Thence generally northwesterly along the centerline of the Vermilion River to a
point in the corporation line north of Cliffside Drive;
Thence southerly and westerly along the corporation line to the place of
beginning.
(d)   Ward Four.
Situated in the City of Vermilion, County of Lorain and State of Ohio being
known as part of Brownhelm Township and more definitely described as follows:
Beginning at the intersection of the easterly corporation line of the City and
the centerline of Liberty Avenue;
Thence westerly in the centerline of Liberty Avenue to a point in the
centerline of the Norfolk & Western Railroad;
Thence southwesterly in the centerline of the Norfolk & Western Railroad, to a
point in the southerly extension of the easterly line of Elberta Beach
Subdivision, as recorded in Volume 10, pages 13 and 14 of Lorain County Plat
Records;
Thence northerly in the easterly line of Elberta Beach Subdivision and in the
southerly extension thereof, to a point in the northerly corporation line of
the City;
Thence easterly in the City’s northerly corporation line to the northeasterly
corner thereof;
Thence southerly in the City’s easterly corporation line, to the place of
beginning.
   (e)   Ward Five.   
Situated in the City of Vermilion, County of Lorain, and State of Ohio.  Being
known as part of Brownhelm Township and more definitely described as follows:
Beginning at the intersection of the centerline of Liberty Avenue and the
easterly corporation line of the City;
Thence in general southerly, westerly, and northwesterly directions in the
City’s corporation lines, to a point at the centerline of the Vermilion River;
Thence generally northerly and westerly in the centerline of the Vermilion
River to a point in the westerly line of Lorain County;
Thence northerly in the westerly line of Lorain County to a point in the
centerline of Lorain County;
Thence northerly in the westerly line of Lorain County to a point in the
centerline of the Conrail Railroad;
Thence easterly in the centerline of the Conrail Railroad to a point in the
centerline of Highbridge Road;
Thence northerly in the centerline of Highbridge Road, to a point in the
centerline of Liberty Avenue;
Thence easterly in the centerline of Liberty Avenue to the place of beginning.
      (Ord.  02-35.  Passed 7-22-02.)

   210.01   MEETINGS OF COUNCIL.
   Council normally will, except as otherwise provided in this section, meet in
regular session at a designated site at 7:00 p.m. on the first and third Monday
of each month. Should any public hearing be scheduled on the first and third
Monday of each month, then Council will meet for regular session immediately
following the public hearing.  Should any holiday fall upon a regular meeting
date, that meeting may be rescheduled upon another date or canceled.
   Additionally, Council may deviate from the normal schedule for other reasons
it may deem appropriate, but in all cases the Charter requirement of one
meeting per month must be met. The Mayor and four members of Council may call
special meetings upon at least twenty-four hours notice to each member, served
personally or to their usual place of residence.
(Ord. 01-7. Passed 3-19-01.)
     
   210.02  QUORUM.
   A quorum shall be required for the transaction of any business by Council.
(Ord. 400. Passed 3-22-54.)
   210.03  NOTICE OF MEETINGS.
   There is hereby established for Council and all boards, commissions,
committees, agencies, authorities or similar decision-making bodies of the City
the following method whereby any person may determine the time, place and
purpose of all regularly scheduled, special and emergency meetings:
   (a)   A regular meeting schedule for the succeeding month shall be available
no later than the twenty-fourth day of each month.  Should the twenty-fourth
day fall upon a Saturday or Sunday, the schedule shall be available on the
preceding Friday.  This schedule shall include all public bodies of the City. 
"Public body" means any board, commission, committee or similar decision-making
body of the City.
   (b)   A public body shall not hold a special meeting unless it gives at
least twenty-four hours advance notice to the news media and others that have
requested notification, except in the event of an emergency requiring immediate
official action.  In the event of an emergency the member or members calling
the meeting shall notify the news media and others that have requested
notification immediately of the time, place and purpose of the meeting.
   (c)   Each public body shall issue an agenda for each meeting.
(1)   Regular meeting agendas shall be available by 12:00 noon on the second
day prior to the scheduled meeting day.  Saturday and Sunday are not to be
considered in this determination.  Failure to include any item on an agenda
does not preclude discussion or action upon that or any other item at a regular
meeting.
(2)   Special meeting agendas shall be available by 4:00 p.m. on the scheduled
meeting day.  Failure to include any item on an agenda does not preclude
discussion or action on that or any other item at a special meeting.
(3)   Emergency meeting agendas shall be available thirty minutes prior to the
meeting at the meeting site.  Discussion or action may be taken only upon items
listed on the agenda.
   (d)   Meeting schedules and agendas shall be made available to any person
upon written request to the Clerk of Council.  These schedules and agendas
shall be provided via U.S. Mail or fax at no charge within a fifty-mile
radius.  Requests for this information outside a fifty-mile radius will be
reviewed on an individual basis to determine whether excess delivery costs will
be incurred and should such be the case, these charges will be assessed to the
requestor.
      (Ord. 95-41.  Passed 8-21-95.)
   210.04  CLERK OF COUNCIL; ASSISTANT TO CLERK.
   (a)    The office of Clerk of Council of the City is hereby established as a
regular full- time position within the unclassified, noncompetitive service of
the City. The Clerk of Council shall serve at the will of the majority of the
members elected or appointed to Council.  The Clerk of Council will be assigned
with the duties of Boards and Commissions, and shall perform such duties as may
be directed by Vermilion City Council, the Mayor, or the Chairman of each
Boards and Commissions. The Clerk of Council shall be compensated as determined
from time to time by Council. Any increase in salary must be presented to
Council and approved by a majority of members of Council, and made only upon
written approval by the President of Council to the Finance Director. The Clerk
of Council shall be entitled to the same benefits and continuing increases
accorded to all other non-classified regular full-time employees of the City.
   (b)    Upon the vacancy of the Clerk of Council’s position, the person
appointed by the Vermilion City Council as Clerk of Council shall within their
first year begin the process of attending the Certified Municipal Clerk’s
Program to earn the CMC designation.
   (c)    There is hereby created the position of Assistant to the Clerk of
Council, who shall be appointed by and serve at the pleasure of Council.  Such
Assistant shall perform such duties as may be directed by the Vermilion City
Council and Clerk of Council.  The Assistant Clerk will assist in the duties of
Boards and Commissions and shall perform such duties as may be directed by
Vermilion City Council, the Clerk of Council, the Mayor, or the Chairman of
each Boards and Commissions.  The compensation to be paid to the Assistant to
the Clerk of Council for the performance of duties shall be determined by
Council.  Any increase in salary must be presented to Council and approved by a
majority of members of Council, and made only upon written approval by the
President of Council to the Finance Director.
   (d)    The Vermilion City Council is hereby authorized to employ a part-time
clerical employee as needed to assist the Clerk of Council to perform duties as
required by law up to twenty (20) hours per week. 
(Ord. 2018-17.  Passed 5-21-18.)
   210.05  SMOKING PROHIBITED.
   No person shall smoke during any meeting of Council or any committee of
Council within the usual meeting chambers or a special meeting room.
(Ord. 95-41.  Passed 8-21-95.)

   212.01   POSTING LEGISLATION; CERTIFICATION.
   (a)   All ordinances and resolutions of Council, and all other acts and
proceedings which Council deems should be published, shall henceforth be
published by having one copy of each ordinance, resolution, act or proceeding
posted in each of the following six places for a period of not less than
fifteen days prior to the taking effect thereof:
(1)   Vermilion Public Library.
(2)   Fire Station - Berkley Road and Overlook Road.
(3)   Brownhelm Town Hall Garage.
(4)   Vermilion City Hall - 5511 Liberty Avenue.
(5)   Municipal Court/Council Facility - 685 Decatur Street.
(6)   Vermilion City Garage - Devon Drive.
   (b)   The Clerk of Council is hereby directed to make an annual certificate
as to each of such publications by posting, which shall list the places where
the posting was done and the dates of the posting, and he or she shall make
such earlier certificates as may be required by law or upon request.
(Ord. 98-9. Passed 3-23-98.)
   212.02  APPLICATION OF LEGISLATION TO CITY LAND BEYOND CORPORATE LIMITS.
   All police and sanitary regulations and all ordinances and resolutions
heretofore or hereafter passed by Council shall have application and are hereby
extended to cover all property owned by the City of Vermilion which is located
beyond the corporate limits. (Ord. 846. Passed 7-1-63.)
