   230.01   ORGANIZATION.
   (a)   The Division of Streets is hereby reorganized to provide for the
creation of officially designated job titles and descriptions and order of
chain of command, as follows:
   Street Superintendent
   Street Maintenance Foreman
   Assistant Foreman (as authorized by the Mayor)
   Equipment Operator II (as authorized by the Mayor)
   Equipment Operator I (as authorized by the Mayor)
   Equipment Operator Trainee (as authorized by the Mayor)
   Laborer II (as authorized by the Mayor)
   Laborer I (as authorized by the Mayor)
(Adopting Ordinance)
   
   (b)   Appointments to such positions shall be made by the Mayor as
appointing authority in accordance with the budgetary appropriations made by
Council in order to provide salaries for Division personnel. The positions of
Equipment Operator II, Equipment Operator I and Equipment Operator Trainee
shall be within the classified competitive civil service of the City. The
position of Laborer I and Laborer II shall be in the classified but
noncompetitive service of the City and the position of Assistant Foreman shall
be within the classified competitive civil service of the City. The Mayor shall
be both the appointing authority and the removing authority.
   (c)   The Mayor shall establish both specifications and job descriptions for
each of such positions and shall file the same, along with a copy of this
section, with the Civil Service Commission. Appointees to such positions shall
be paid in accordance with the general payroll plan of the City and grades,
steps and classifications established thereby and in accordance with budgetary
appropriations made by Council.
(Ord. 82-60. Passed 12-6-82.)
   230.02   STREET MAINTENANCE FOREMAN.
   (a)   The position of Street Maintenance Foreman is hereby established in
the classified service of the City.
   (b)   The Street Maintenance Foreman shall be appointed by the Mayor and the
Director of Public Service. He or she shall report to and be directly
responsible to the Street Superintendent, who shall direct his or her work
effort, and he or she shall cooperatively work with all department heads in
carrying out public maintenance and repair functions. The Street Maintenance
Foreman shall ordinarily be in the classified competitive civil service of the
City, and he or she shall be subject to layoff, transfer, reduction, suspension
or removal by the initial action of the Director. The Mayor and the Director
shall establish job specifications for the Street Maintenance Foreman, which
specifications shall include the following, among others:  cooperating with
administration and all other department heads in effecting maintenance and
repair operations; reporting work progress to the Mayor, the Director and
affected department heads upon a regular basis; being familiar with City owned
equipment and keeping it in repair and good working order; keeping adequate
tools, supplies, parts and other appurtenances on hand and secured in order to
carry on departmental functions; cooperating with official requests in liaison
with the Mayor; training, orienting and educating department employees in the
maintenance of equipment; and offering suggestions, innovations and guidance to
fellow employees and the City administration involving repair and maintenance
functions.
   (c)   The Street Maintenance Foreman shall be compensated in accordance with
Range 10 of the Wage and Salary Schedule of the City. The exact rate of pay
shall be established by the recommendation of the Director and the approval of
the Mayor.
CHAPTER 232
Division of Building Inspection

CROSS REFERENCES
      Power to regulate building erection - see Ohio R.C.
            715.26, 715.29, 737.28, 737.37
      Dangerous or abandoned buildings - see GEN. OFF.
         
660.09;  B. & H. Ch.
1478
      Chief Building Inspector as Administrative Officer
         for Zoning Code enforcement - see P. & Z.
 1262.02
      Powers and duties of Chief Building Inspector - see
         B. & H
. 1440.01
      Appointments of building inspectors - see B. & H.
         
1440.02
      Authority of building inspectors re projections over
         public property - see B. & H. 1470.03
CHAPTER 234
Division of Utilities
234.01   Establishment.
234.02   Qualifications and appointment of Manager.
234.03   Duties of Manager.
234.04   Compensation of Manager.
234.05   Laboratory Technician.
234.06   Wastewater Treatment Plant Maintenance Mechanic.
234.07   Water Plant and Distribution Superintendent.
234.08   Treatment Plant Relief Operator/Maintenance Person.
CROSS REFERENCES
      Public Utilities Commission - see Ohio R.C. Ch. 4909
      Gas, electric and water companies - see Ohio R.C. Ch. 4933
      Classification of workers - see ADM
. 270.05

   234.01   ESTABLISHMENT.
   Pursuant to
 Article V, Section 1, of the City Charter, there is hereby established a
Division of Utilities in the Department of Public Service.
(Ord. 77-11. Passed 3-7-77.)
   234.02  QUALIFICATIONS AND APPOINTMENT OF MANAGER.
   (a)   The Manager of the Division of Utilities shall be employed by the
Mayor and shall serve at the pleasure of the Mayor. The Manager shall possess,
at a minimum, a Class III State of Ohio Wastewater Treatment Plant Operator's
License and a Class III State of Ohio Water Treatment Plant Operator's License.
   (b)   After the effective date of this section, the position of Manager of
the Division of Utilities shall be in the classified service of the civil
service as provided in
Article VII, Section 2, of the City Charter.
   (c)   The employee serving as the Utilities Manager shall, on the effective
date of this section, be so placed in the classified service in such position
without examination.
   234.03   DUTIES OF MANAGER.
   The Utilities Manager shall be charged with the general overall operation of
the Water and Wastewater Treatment Plants and shall assume all other duties as
directed by the City Charter. The Manager shall be in charge of designing and
directing work methods for the Water and Wastewater Treatment Plants and shall
project future needs of the City in its water and sewer operations.
   234.04   COMPENSATION OF MANAGER.
   The compensation of the Utiltiies Manager shall be established in accordance
with Range 9 of the Salary and Wage Schedule of the City.
   234.05  LABORATORY TECHNICIAN.
   (a)   Within the Department of Public Service, Utilities Division, there is
hereby established the position of Laboratory Technician.
   (b)   The Laboratory Technician shall be appointed by the Mayor, after
recommendation by the Utilities Manager, and shall be under the general
direction of the Water Plant Operator and the Wastewater Treatment Plant
Operator. The Laboratory Technician will be responsible for performing
analytical techniques as required in water and wastewater laboratories by State
and Federal regulations and perform related tasks as required by such operators
or the Utilities Manager.
   (c)   The Laboratory Technician shall possess a thorough knowledge of
laboratory techniques for analyzing water and wastewater samples, the ability
to plan and organize the workings of modern water and wastewater laboratories
and the ability to maintain records and prepare reports.
 
   (d)   The Laboratory Technician shall be within the classiffed civil service
of the City and shall continue to hold all previous protections, benefits,
duties and responsibilities thereunder if transferring from another classified
job description. A copy of this section shall be served upon the Civil Service
Commission by the Clerk of Council.
(Ord. 81-24.  Passed 3-16-81.)
 
   (e)   The Finance Director is hereby authorized and directed to compensate
the Laboratory Technician, from both the Water and Sewer Funds, in accordance
with Range 9 of the Salary and Wage Schedule of the City at a step established
by the Mayor.
   234.06  WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANT MAINTENANCE MECHANIC.
   (a)   Within the Department of Public Service, Utilities Division, there is
hereby established the position of Wastewater Treatment Plant Maintenance
Mechanic, who shall be appointed by the Mayor after recommendation by the
Utilities Manager and who shall be under the general supervision of the
Wastewater Treatment Plant Operator. The Wastewater Treatment Plant Maintenance
Mechanic is responsible for performing work involving construction, maintenance
and repair of equipment and facilities at the wastewater treatment plant and
wastewater pumping stations and for performing related tasks as required by the
Operator or the Utilities Manager.
 
   (b)   The Wastewater Treatment Plant Maintenance Mechanic shall possess
considerable knowledge of construction, maintenance methods, equipment and
materials commonly found in wastewater treatment facility and wastewater
pumping stations. He or she shall possess the ability to read and interpret
equipment maintenance instructions and engineering detail design drawings.
 
   (c)   The Wastewater Treatment Plant Maintenance Mechanic shall be within
the classified civil service of the City and shall continue to hold all
previous protections, benefits, duties and responsibilities thereinunder if
transferring from another classified job description. A copy hereof shall be
served upon the Civil Service Commission by the Clerk of Council. (Ord. 81-25. 
Passed 3-16-81.)
   (d)   The Finance Director is hereby authorized and directed to compensate
the Wastewater Treatment Plant Maintenance Mechanic, from both the Water and
Sewer Funds, in accordance with Range 11 of the Salary and Wage Schedule of the
City at a step established by the Mayor.
   234.07  WATER PLANT AND DISTRIBUTION SUPERINTENDENT.
   Within the Department of Public Service, there is hereby established the
position of Water Plant and Distribution Superintendent.  The job description
of such position is attached to original Ordinance 98-21, passed April 20,
1998, and marked "Exhibit A."  Such position shall be in the classified service
of the City and the person holding this position shall be appointed by the
Mayor and shall be responsible to the Director of Public Service and the Mayor.
(Ord. 98-21.  Passed 4-20-98; Ord. 98-60.  Passed 9-21-98.)
   234.08  TREATMENT PLANT RELIEF OPERATOR/MAINTENANCE PERSON.
   (a)   Within the Department of Public Service, there is hereby established
the position of Treatment Plant Relief Operator/Maintenance Person, who shall
be appointed by the Mayor, after recommendation by the Utilities Manager, and
who shall be under the general supervision of the Utilities Manager.  It is
further provided, however, that the immediate supervisor of such position shall
be the responsibility of either the Sanitary Water Producing Superintendent or
the Wastewater Treatment Plant Superintendent, depending upon which relief
plant said operator is then assigned.  Under the immediate supervision of such
respected Superintendent, he or she shall operate and maintain equipment
associated with the respective treatment plant processes and perform such other
related tasks that are required by the immediate supervisor or the Utilities
Manager.
 
   (b)   The Treatment Plant Relief Operator/Manager Person shall possess any
combination of training or experience equivalent to completion of the twelfth
grade with emphasis on mathematics and science background.  He or she will have
completed one year of actual water or wastewater treatment plant experience at
the time of application.  He or she shall be required to obtain an Ohio E.P.A.
Class I Operator's Certificate in both water and wastewater within four years
from the date of his or her appointment.  He or she shall possess mechanical
aptitude; ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships with
associates and fellow employees as well as management; and ability to maintain
records and prepare reports required of him or her.  He or she shall
demonstrate and continue to possess the ability and willingness to learn to
make repairs and actually repair a variety of machinery and equipment, as well
as to use machinery and equipment in both treatment plants.
 
   (c)   The Treatment Plant Relief Operator/Maintenance Person shall
substitute for any and all other treatment plant operators during times of
absence when so assigned by the Utilities Manager.  During such times, in
addition to any other related duties that may be assigned to him or her from
time to time, he or she shall operate pumps, control panels, valves, pumping
station equipment, chemical feeders and other equipment, and maintain and
repair the same as needed.
   He or she shall perform various laboratory analyses and collect samples as
required; adjust flows and chemical feeds as indicated by such lab tests to
produce optimum plant results; make periodic rounds of the treatment plant and
its facilities, checking charts, equipment operations, meters etc.; and
maintain a log of plant operations.  He or she shall assist in maintaining the
plant in a clean and orderly condition by sweeping and mopping floors,
shoveling snow as required and mowing grass.  He or she shall assist in plant
maintenance by disassembling machines, pumps and other equipment and
reassembling the same; perform routine equipment lubrication and equipment
testing as required; repair damaged parts; replace any other parts; and make
creative and meaningful recommendations to management.
   (d)   The appointee to such position shall serve a six-month probationary
period during which time he or she may be dismissed by the Mayor upon
recommendation of the Utilities Manager for any reason whatsoever and without
cause.  During such probationary period, his or her compensation shall be
established at Range Eight, Step Three.  In the event an existing employee
shall be appointed to the position, he or she shall not be decreased in pay
during his or her probationary period, and in the event an existing employee
shall be initially appointed to such office and shall be removed during his or
her probationary period, he or she shall automatically be reassigned to his or
her former classification as before such appointment.  After the probationary
period has been successfully fulfilled, he or she shall possess all the
protections and responsibilities granted by Civil Service laws and shall be
given a one step pay raise increment and successive one step pay raises every
six months thereafter to a maximum of Range Eight, Step Nine, provided that
each step pay raise has been previously approved by the Utilities Manager, who
may withhold the same at his or her sole discretion.  The Finance Director is
hereby authorized and directed to compensate the Treatment Plant Relief
Operator/Maintenance Person in accordance with the terms hereof along with the
general payroll of employees of the City of Vermilion, Ohio.
(Ord. 88-38.  Passed 6-6-88.)

   (b)   The Humane Officer shall be appointed by the Mayor and shall serve at

   240.01   ESTABLISHMENT; COMPOSITION.
   A Police Division is hereby established for the City. The Division shall
consist of a Chief of Police, appointed by the Mayor, and such other officers
and employees as may be authorized by Council. (Ord. 639.  Passed 3-6-61.)
     
   240.02  MAXIMUM AGE OF NEW APPOINTEES.
   Under the authority granted by
 Article VII, Section 5, of the City Charter, Council hereby establishes the
maximum age of new members of the Police Division at thirty-five years. (Ord.
72-85.  Passed 10-16-72.)
     
   240.03   UNIFORM ALLOWANCES.
   For the purposes of this section, the Director of Public Safety shall
determine who are full-time policemen and who are part-time policemen. 
   A uniform allowance shall be paid to personnel only for uniforms actually
purchased. Payment shall be made after a bill for the uniforms has been
presented by the policeman to the Director.
   (a)   Police Officers.
(1)   All full-time regular police officers of the Police Division shall
receive an allowance not to exceed four hundred twenty-five dollars ($425.00)
for the first year of full-time duty and an allowance not to exceed three
hundred twenty-five dollars ($325.00) per year for each succeeding year, to be
used for the purchase of uniforms.
(2)   All part-time police officers shall receive an allowance not to exceed
two hundred dollars ($200.00) for the first year of part-time duty and an
allowance not to exceed two hundred dollars ($200.00) per  year for each
succeeding year to be used for the purchase of uniforms.
(3)   Such allowances shall not accumulate from year to year.
   (b)   Dispatchers.
(1)   There is hereby established a clothing allowance to be paid to Police
Division dispatchers for the purchase of uniforms. Such allowance is as
follows:
         A.   Full-time dispatchers shall receive an allowance not to exceed
two hundred twenty-five dollars ($225.00) for the first year of full-time duty
and an allowance not to exceed two hundred twenty-five dollars ($225.00) per
year each succeeding year.
         B.   Part-time dispatchers shall receive an allowance not to exceed
one hundred dollars ($100.00) for the first year of part-time duty and an
allowance not to exceed seventy-five dollars ($75.00) per year for each
succeeding year.
(2)   Such allowances shall not accumulate from year to year.
   (c)   Police Maintenance Allowance.
(1)   The Chief of Police, regular full-time supervisory officers and regular
full-time uniformed patrolmen shall receive, in addition to all other
compensation, three hundred dollars ($300.00) per year for a uniform
maintenance clothing allowance, payable semiannually, on July 1 and December 1.
(2)   All uniformed part-time patrolmen shall be compensated for actual expense
in the cleaning of their uniforms soiled in the line of duty, upon presentation
and approval by the Chief of receipted statements therefor, payable
semiannually.
   (d)   Dispatcher Maintenance Allowance. All of the full-time police
dispatchers employed by the Police Division who are required to wear uniforms
shall receive an allowance of one hundred eighty-five dollars ($185.00) per
year, payable semiannually on July 1 and December 1.
      (Ord. 81-48.  Passed 9-21-81.)
       
   240.04  FULL-TIME POLICE DISPATCHERS IN CIVIL SERVICE.
   All of the full-time regular police dispatchers of the Police Division of
the City shall be in the classified service of the civil service as provided in
Article VII, Section 2, of the City Charter.
   The full-time regular police dispatchers, who are full-time regular police
dispatchers and members of the Police Division on the effective date of this
section (Ordinance 68-18, passed February 19, 1968), shall be placed in the
classified service in their respective positions without examination.
(Ord. 68-18. Passed 2-19-68.)
 
   240.05   AMBULANCE SERVICE ASSIGNED TO POLICE; SERVICE CHARGES. (REPEALED)
    (EDITOR'S NOTE: Section 240.05 was repealed by Ordinance 96-4, passed
February 20, 1996.)
     
   240.06   COMPENSATION FOR POLICE SCIENCE DEGREE CREDIT HOURS.
   All full-time regular members of the Police Division who hold the rank of
Third Class patrolman or higher, will receive, in addition to all other
compensation, an additional monthly sum computed as follows:
One dollar ($1.00) multiplied by the number of completed quarter credit hours
earned towards the awarding of a Police Science Associate Degree up to and
including 100 credit hours by an educational institution approved by the Mayor.
All compensation received by virtue of this section shall be computed as of the
end of the spring quarter of 1973, of the applicable educational institution.
Each individual's additional compensation as stated herein will be recomputed
after the spring and fall academic quarter of each year.
   (Ord. 73-21.  Passed 3-19-73.)
   240.07  ADOPTION OF RULES AND REGULATIONS.
   Council hereby accepts and adopts the rules and regulations of the Vermilion
Police Division, as amended. (Ord. 74-38.  Passed 4-15-74.)
   240.08   JUVENILE BUREAU.
   There is hereby established a Juvenile Bureau within the Police Division.
The Juvenile Bureau will maintain contact with the various courts, schools and
youth-oriented groups and other governmental agencies in order to prevent
juvenile delinquency within the community. The members of the Juvenile Bureau
will be members of the Police Division. (Ord. 75-63. Passed 8-4-75.)
   240.09  SPECIAL EMERGENCY MEDICAL TECHNICIAN ATTENDANT. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: Section 240.09 was repealed by Ordinance 96-4, passed
February 20, 1996.)
     
   240.10   CITY WATERCRAFT OPERATOR.
   There is hereby created, within the Police Division, the position of City
Watercraft Operator. The appointment of each such position shall be made by the
Mayor and each Operator shall serve at the pleasure of the Mayor. Such
Operators shall be part-time employees in the nonclassified and noncompetitive
service of the City and shall enjoy no fringe benefits, except as required by
law. Such Operators shall be responsible directly to the Chief of Police and
the chain of command established by the Chief in such Division. Not more than
three persons shall be authorized to be such Operators.
(Ord. 80-30.  Passed 5-5-80.)
       
   240.11   CIVILIAN OPERATOR OF THE WATERCRAFT SAFETY PATROL BOAT.
   (a)   The part-time position of Civilian Operator of the Watercraft Safety
Patrol Boat, owned by the City, is hereby established in the unclassified
service of the City. Appointments to such position shall be made by the Mayor
upon recommendation by the Police Chief. (Adopting Ordinance)
     
   (b)   The requirements for employment in such position are as follows:
(1)   Passage of U.S.C.G. boating safety course or equivalent;
(2)   Passage of Red Cross lifesaving course or equivalent;
(3)   Proficient swimmer;
(4)   Sound physical condition;
(5)   Passage of physical examination;
(6)   Any and all other requirements deemed necessary by the Chief of Police
and/or the Mayor.
   (c)   The duties for the position shall be designated by the Chief of
Police. The persons holding such position shall be under the supervision of the
Chief of Police and the Marine Patrol Officer of the Police Division on duty.
(Ord. 76-27.  Passed 5-17-76.)
   240.12  POLICE DISPATCHER/LEADS SUPERVISOR.
   (a)   There is hereby established in the Police Division the position of
Police Dispatcher/LEADS Supervisor. Such position shall be filled by
promotional examination from those persons now holding a full-time position of
Police Dispatcher not on a probationary basis. The Director of Public Safety
and the Police Chief shall determine any further qualifications for such
position and the Civil Service Commission shall commence procedures to test
according to law for the person best qualified to fill such position.
 
   (b)   The Finance Director is hereby authorized and directed to pay an
hourly salary for such position, as determined by Council, commencing January
1, 1987, along with the general payroll of employees of the City.
 
   (c)   The duties of such position shall be defined by the Director of Public
Safety and the Chief of Police, but shall include the control, training and
supervision of the use of the LEADS terminal in the City.
(Ord. 86-75.  Passed 11-17-86.)
   240.13  AUXILIARY POLICE UNIT.
   (a)    There is established within the Police Department of the City of
Vermilion an Auxiliary Police Unit.
   (b)    The Director of Public Safety shall be the executive head of the
Auxiliary Police Unit; shall make all appointments and removals of auxiliary
police officers, subject to any general rules prescribed by Council by
ordinance, and shall prescribe rules for the organization, training,
administration, control and conduct of the Auxiliary Po1ice Unit.
   (c)    The Chief of Police shall be the commanding officer of the Auxiliary
Police Unit and shall have control of the assignment, stationing and the
direction of work of the members of the Auxiliary Police Unit. The members of
the Auxiliary Police Unit shall perform only such police duties as are assigned
by the Chief of Police and shall act only when in the prescribed uniform or
partial uniform. The members of the Auxiliary Police Unit shall obey the chain
of command of the Police Department and shall take orders from all regular
appointed members thereof.
   (d)    Members of the Auxiliary Police Unit shall not be in the classified
service of the City. The tenure of every member of the Auxiliary Police Unit
shall he "at will" and may be terminated at any time, without cause and without
prior notice.
   (e)    Members of the Auxiliary Police Unit shall not receive compensation
from the City for their services as auxiliary police officers.
   (f)    The City shall maintain worker's compensation insurance for each
auxiliary police officer.
   (g)    The City may pay for the initial uniforms and/or initial training of
members of the Auxiliary Police Unit. However, if prior to the first
anniversary of his or her appointment as an auxiliary police officer, a member
resigns or is discharged without cause from the Auxiliary Police Unit, and such
resignation or discharge is for a reason other than physical disability, then
such member shall reimburse the City for any money expended by the City for
such member's uniform and/or training.
   (h)    At such time as a member of the Auxiliary Police Unit ceases to be an
auxiliary police officer, such former member shall turn over to the Chief of
Police such former member's badge and uniform.  (Ord. 2011-71.  Passed 10-3-
11.)

   242.01  ESTABLISHMENT; COMPOSITION.
   A Fire Division is hereby established for the City. The Division shall
consist of a Fire Chief, appointed by the Mayor, and such number of volunteer
firemen as may be authorized by Council. (Ord. 826.  Passed 5-6-63.)
   242.02  DIVISION INTO TWO COMPANIES.
   The Fire Division shall be divided into two companies. One company shall be
stationed at the South Street Fire Station in the City which company shall be
known as the Number 1 Fire Company, and the Station shall be known as the
Number 1 Fire Station. The other company shall be stationed at the Overlook
Boulevard Fire Station in the City which company shall be known as the Number 2
Fire Company, and the Station shall be known as the Number 2 Fire Station.
(Ord. 826.  Passed 5-6-63.)
   242.03  MAXIMUM AGE OF NEW APPOINTEES. (RESCINDED)
   EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
242.03 was repealed by Ordinance 2016-23.
   242.04   FIRE MARSHAL.
   (a)   There is hereby established in the unclassified service of the City
the position of Fire Marshal. The position shall be filled by appointment by
the Mayor, and the person holding the position shall serve at the pleasure of
the Mayor. The compensation for the position shall be at the same hourly rate
as the hourly rate paid members of the Fire Division.
(Ord. 66-51.  Passed 6-20-66.)
   (b)   The Fire Marshal shall perform the duties and have the authority
prescribed by the Ohio Revised Code and the Codified Ordinances of the City and
such additional duties and authority as shall be prescribed from time to time
by Council, the Fire Chief and the Mayor. He shall also serve as Chief of the
Bureau of Fire Prevention of the City.
(Ord. 75-54.  Passed 6-16-75.)
   242.05   FIRE PREVENTION BUREAU.
   There is hereby established in the City a Fire Prevention Bureau. The Fire
Prevention Bureau shall be supervised by the Fire Marshal and the Chief of the
Fire Division. The Bureau shall be composed of six members of the Fire Division
including the Fire Marshal. The compensation for members of the Bureau shall be
the same hourly rate as training time rate. The Bureau members shall perform
the duties and have the authority prescribed by the Ohio Revised Code and the
Codified Ordinances of the City and such additional duties and authority as
shall be prescribed from time to time by the Chief of the Fire Division.
(Ord. 75-54.  Passed 6-16-75.)

   244.01   RECREATION AND PARK PERSONNEL.
   (a)   There is hereby established the position of Director of Parks and
Recreation of the City. The duties of such appointee shall be to implement and
supervise the recreation program of the City as established by the Parks and
Recreation Board. Such appointee shall serve at the pleasure of the Board,
shall be directly responsible to the Board, shall comply, so far as is
practical, with the reasonable requests of the Mayor and shall work in
cooperation with other department heads. The Director shall be compensated as
determined by Council and his or her time records shall be approved by the
Chairperson of the Board.
   (b)   There is hereby established the position of Assistant Director of
Parks and Recreation of the City, with as many as two appointees for such
position hereby authorized. The duties of the Assistant Director shall be to
support the Director, to whom he or she shall be immediately responsible. Such
appointees shall be hired by the Parks and Recreation Board and serve at its
pleasure. The compensation of such Assistant Directors shall be as determined
by Council and his or her time records shall be approved by the Chairperson of
the Board.
 
   (c)   There is hereby established the position of Supervisor of Park
Maintenance, who shall be appointed by and serve at the pleasure of the Parks
and Recreation Board. His or her primary duties shall include the maintenance,
repair, upkeep, renovation and aesthetic appearance of the various public lands
under the control and jurisdiction of the Board. The compensation of such
Supervisor shall be as determined by Council, with all time schedules being
approved by the Chairperson of the Board.
 
   (d)   There is hereby established the position of Park Maintenance
Personnel, with as many as four appointees for such position hereby authorized.
They shall be appointed by and serve at the pleasure of the Parks and
Recreation Board. The duties of such personnel shall be to serve and otherwise
assist the Supervisor of Park Maintenance in his or her duties. The
compensation of such personnel shall be as determined by Council, with the time
schedule to be approved by the Supervisor of Park Maintenance.
   (e)   The compensation of playground supervisory personnel shall be as
determined by Council, with the time schedule to be approved by the Supervisor
of Park Maintenance.
 
   (f)      The Compensation for Field Maintenance Personnel shall be
determined by Council, with the time schedule to be approved by the Parks and
Recreation Director. Compensation for Youth Baseball Umpires shall be at a rate
schedule determined by Council per umpire per game, with the specific
compensation to be determined by the Parks and Recreation Board.
 
   (g)   All appointments referred to in this section shall be considered part-
time personnel of the City within the nonclassified, noncompetitive service and
shall receive no fringe benefits.
(Ord. 80-28.  Passed 5-5-80; Ord. 86-18B.  Passed 3-17-86.)

   246.01  ESTABLISHMENT OF POSITION; APPOINTMENT.
   (a)   The position of City Engineer is hereby established.
 
   (b)   The Mayor is hereby authorized to employ a professional engineer to
serve as City Engineer to perform such services and duties as are established
by Section
246.02 or, at the Mayor's option, to employ a firm of professional engineers
which shall be appointed by the Mayor and confirmed by Council and which firm
may be relieved of such appointment in a similar manner.
(Ord. 78-82.  Passed 7-5-78.)
   246.02  DUTIES.
   The duties of the City Engineer shall be as follows:
   (a)   Attendance at the Following:
(1)   Council:
         A.   All regular meetings;
         B.   Special meetings as requested by the President of Council.
(2)   Planning Commission:
         A.   All regular meetings;
         B.   Special meetings as requested by the Chairman of the Planning
Commission.
(3)   Board of Zoning Appeals, as requested by the Chairman of the Board of
Zoning Appeals.
(4)   Port Authority, as requested by the Chairman of the Port Authority.
(5)   Parks and Recreation Board, as requested by the Chairman of the Parks and
Recreation Board.
   (b)   Service to Municipal Departments.
(1)   Public Safety Department (Police and Fire Divisions):
         A.   Attend meetings as required by the Safety Director when
engineering advice or service requests will be on the agenda of such meetings.
(2)   Public Service Department:
         A.   Street Division:
               1.   Plan storm drainage systems, including:
                  Size of area mains.
                  Size of other collector mains.
                  Size of individual street sewers.
                  Location and size of catch basins and/or manholes.
            2.   Plan resurfacing projects, including possibly needed curbing. 
Determine the type of material, method of installation and scope of work to be
done by the City forces and scope of work to be done by outside contractors.
            3.   Determine the specifications of all materials to be purchased
for the Street Division.
         B.    Water Bureau:
            1.   Plan water service extension and/or improvement. The designs
submitted are to reflect and/or project future capacities needed to service
extended areas of the City.
            2.   Plan for water reservoirs and/or water towers needed for the
City, including the needed capacities of such water towers and/or reservoirs.
            3.   Work directly with the Utilities Maintenance Foreman in
updating and improving the operating equipment that is deemed necessary for
maintaining proper service to the City.
         C.   Sewer Bureau:
            1.   Plan sewer service extension and/or improvement. The plans
submitted are to reflect and/or project future capacity capability needed to
service expanded areas of the City as well as any sections presently located
outside of the City which may become a part of a City controlled water or sewer
district.
            2.   Work directly with the Wastewater Treatment Plant Operator in
updating and improving the sewerage operating treatment system which may be
deemed necessary for proper service to the City or the sewerage district.
   (c)   Technical Advice to the City Administration and Council.
(1)   State and Federal programs:
         A.   Maintain a program of information and contact with State and
Federal departments on funding aid for streets and water and sewer
improvements.
         B.   Upon the approval of Council and the administration, process the
necessary requests for grants and other aids.
(2)   Contracts issued by the City:
         A.   To advise the administration and Council on the most economical
installation of any project being considered.
         B.   To write the specifications for the various improvement contracts
to be let by the City.
               (Ord. 70-11.  Passed 3-16-70.)

   248.01   ESTABLISHMENT.
   There is hereby established an agency to be known as the Disaster Services
Agency of the City of Vermilion. (Ord. 74-33.  Passed 4-1-74.)
   248.02  DIRECTOR OF CIVIL DISASTERS.
   The Director of Civil Disasters shall be appointed by the Mayor subject to
confirmation by a majority vote of Council. The Director shall coordinate the
administration and operation of the Disaster Services Agency of the City,
subject to direction and control of the Mayor.
(Ord. 74-34.  Passed 4-1-74.)
   248.03  ICE BREAKER OPERATORS.
   There is hereby authorized and created, in the official City personnel
classification and job authorization within the roster of employees of the
City, a noncompetitive, nonclassified position known as ice breaker operator.
Eight of such ice breaker operators are hereby authorized.
   Such position shall be a part-time, seasonal and emergency position in the
City with no fringe benefits, provided, however, that the Director of Finance
is hereby authorized and directed to include such position within Workers'
Compensation provisions of the State, if eligible, and/or as a position covered
by public liability insurance of the City. The Finance Director is further
authorized to pay any and all increases in premiums to provide for such
coverages when available under law or under the extension or modification of
existing policies of liability insurance of the City.
   The Mayor is hereby authorized to appoint eight individuals to the position
of ice breaker operator and, at his or her discretion, to remove such
individuals. Such appointments shall be for an indefinite and continuous period
of time until resignation, incapacity or removal by the Mayor. The powers and
duties of such ice breaker operators shall include, but not be limited to, the
operation of any and all vessels owned by the City during perilous times upon
the Vermilion River; breaking of ice upon the Vermilion River; doing any and
all acts necessary to protect and preserve life and property from the common
enemy of flooding river waters and ice jams; and entering upon all areas in and
around the Vermilion River and the area of the mouth of the River and Lake Erie
to perform such heroic duty. If compensation is to be paid therefor, the same
shall be established by the Mayor, with confirmation by Council. All ice
breaker operators shall be directed by the Mayor and shall cooperate with the
Director of Public Service in the performance of their functions. Such
functions shall be considered an appendage to the civil disaster services
rendered by the City.
(Ord. 86-12.  Passed 2-3-86.)

CHAPTER 252
Employees Generally
   EDITOR'S NOTE: Because of the frequency of change, provisions relating to
regular compensation and bonds are not codified. Copies of the latest relevant
legislation may be obtained, at cost, from the Clerk of Council. The City
enters into Agreements, from time to time, with representatives of various
classes of Municipal employees. Such Agreements provide for compensation,
benefits and conditions of employment. The City also enacts ordinances from
time to time providing for compensation, benefits and/or conditions of
employment for particular officers and employees. The provisions of this
chapter, therefore, are applicable only to those personnel and those subjects
not otherwise provided for in such Agreements and/or such ordinances. In the
event of a conflict between any of the provisions of this chapter and a
provision of any such Agreement or ordinance, the provision of such Agreement
or ordinance prevails. Copies of the latest relevant legislation, and of such
Agreements, may be obtained, at cost, from the Clerk of Council.
252.01   Vacations.
252.02   Sick leave.
